p: Buettner and co-workers [ 168, 169, 170, 171] used MDGC-MS/O techniques to investigate intense malodours and hazardous chemicals in children toys, balloons, balls, hairbrushes, inflatable pillows, elastic therapeutic tapes, artistsâ€™ acrylic paint and other commercial products. Some of the most intense and unpleasant odours detected in these products were classified as car tyre/rubber-like, pungent, burning sensation, artificial leather-like, plastic-like, glue-like and nail-polish-like. The most frequent compound classes identified were aldehydes, carboxylic acids, lactones, indoles, phenols, alcohols, hydrocarbons and PAHs.
